page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Some children at Middle Park Primary School asked local people about employment. "I asked 46 people if they had jobs. 11 people said they didn't and 2O people said they did. Out of the 2O people that had jobs 6 people worked in London and the other l4 people worked locally. The unemployment number in this area is not really that bad but still is not good. Children in this area are very familiar with the word "redundant" although the South East is considered to be relatively lucky.Of course children were likely to meet a high proportion of retired and unemployed by doing their survey locally during the school day.
